name: Bone
description: Bone is a specialized connective tissue with a mineralized extracellular matrix. It supports the body and protects organs.

features: Osteons (Haversian Systems): Structural units of compact bone
Haversian Canal: Central channel containing blood vessels/nerves
Concentric Lamellae: Rings of matrix around the canal
Osteocytes: Mature bone cells in lacunae between lamellae
theory.examTips: Look for the 'Onion' appearance of Osteons. Black dots = Lacunae containing Osteocytes. Black lines radiating from dots = Canaliculi. In decalcified bone, matrix stains pink (eosinophilic).

name: Bone Marrow
description: Bone marrow tissue usually appears in sections of cancellous bone. It contains hematopoietic cells and adipocytes.

features: Hematopoietic cells: Mixture of erythroid/myeloid precursors (Red marrow)
Bone Trabeculae: Eosinophilic spicules of bone surrounding marrow spaces
location: Spaces of spongy bone (vertebrae, ribs, sternum)
theory.examTips: In a bone slide, the 'messy' purple stuff between the pink bone trabeculae is the marrow. If mostly fat (clear circles) = Yellow Marrow. If mostly cells (purple dots) = Red Marrow.

name: Cancellous Bone
description: Cancellous (spongy/trabecular) bone consists of a network of bony spicules (trabeculae). The spaces are filled with bone marrow.

features: Trabeculae: Anastomosing branching plates of bone
theory.examTips: Pink islands of bone (with osteocytes) surrounded by marrow. Does NOT look like an onion (no concentric lamellae of osteons). Osteoblasts line the surface of trabeculae.

name: Epiphyseal Growth Plate
description: The epiphyseal plate is a zone of hyaline cartilage responsible for longitudinal bone growth. It shows distinct zones of chondrocyte activity.

features: Zone of Resting Cartilage: Small, scattered chondrocytes
Zone of Proliferation: Chondrocytes stacked in columns (coins)
Zone of Hypertrophy: Large, swollen chondrocytes
Zone of Calcification: Dead chondrocytes, calcified matrix
Zone of Ossification: Osteoblasts deposit bone on calcified cartilage spicules
location: Between Epiphysis and Diaphysis of growing long bones
theory.examTips: Memorize the order: Real People Have Career Options (Resting, Proliferation, Hypertrophy, Calcification, Ossification). Look for the 'stacks of coins' in the Proliferative zone.

name: Normal Bone
description: Normal cortical (compact) bone is composed of densely packed osteons. It forms the hard outer shell of bones.

theory.examTips: Similar to the 'Bone' slide but emphasizes the cortical arrangement. Look for the regular arrangement of circular Osteons. Differentiate High Power vs Low Power views.

name: Skeletal muscle
description: Skeletal muscle consists of long, multinucleated, cylindrical fibers with striations. It is under voluntary control.

theory.examTips: 3 Keys: Cylindrical shape (no branching), Peripheral nuclei ( nuclei are NOT in the center), Striations (visible at high power). Cross-section shows polygonal fields of Cohnheim.
